repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Github Issue template:

- Add pointers to |dev-tools-backtrace|.
- Add pointers to CONTRIBUTING.md (Reporting Problems), which includes
  additional helpful instructions for issue reporting.
- Search existing issues: include label `bug-crash` as well as `bug`.

CONTRIBUTING.md:

- Fix broken link on "stacktrace" after moving to help from wiki.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,8 +9,8 @@ body:
         *Before reporting:*
         - Confirm the problem is reproducible on [**master**](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/nightly) or [**latest stable**](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/stable) release
         - run `make distclean` when encountering build issues
-        - search [existing issues](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug)
-        - check the [FAQ](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/FAQ)
+        - search [existing issues](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug,bug-crash) (including [closed!](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+label%3Abug%2Cbug-crash))

comment_data.body: That would be better, thanks. Done
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,8 +9,8 @@ body:
         *Before reporting:*
         - Confirm the problem is reproducible on [**master**](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/nightly) or [**latest stable**](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/stable) release
         - run `make distclean` when encountering build issues
-        - search [existing issues](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug)
-        - check the [FAQ](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/FAQ)
+        - search [existing issues](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug,bug-crash) (including [closed!](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+label%3Abug%2Cbug-crash))

comment_data.body:
Not specific to this PR but it gave me the idea: what do we think about making each of these items a checkbox? That gives us (the triagers) some feedback that users actually have read the items (it's true that some people will blindly click every checkbox anyway, but I predict _most_ won't).

So e.g. something like this:

```
*Before reporting:*
- [ ] I have confirmed the problem is reproducible on **master** or **latest stable**
- [ ] If my issue is a build issue, I have run `make distclean`
- [ ] I have searched for existing issues
```

etc.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,8 +9,8 @@ body:
         *Before reporting:*
         - Confirm the problem is reproducible on [**master**](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/nightly) or [**latest stable**](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/stable) release
         - run `make distclean` when encountering build issues
-        - search [existing issues](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug)
-        - check the [FAQ](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/FAQ)
+        - search [existing issues](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug,bug-crash) (including [closed!](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+label%3Abug%2Cbug-crash))

comment_data.body:
Hmm, not sure I'm in favor of this, for three reasons:
1. as you mentioned many (more than you expect; I wager most) people will just ignore this (or blindly click if we enforce this; see next point);
2. it's hard to enforce -- what will we do when something isn't ticked? close the issue? politely ask them (as we do now)?
3. such checkboxes appear as a task list in the PR view; this can be helpful (only need to look at PRs where all tasks are completed) but will make _actual_ task lists in tracking-type issues less visible.

Such boxes would be much more valuable if they would actually guide the user through steps (kinda like your second example) -- so less "I _swear_ I did X" and more "First do X, then..."

But this would require the steps to be relevant to the issue, and we'd end up creating LunarVim-startup-flowcharts...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,8 +9,8 @@ body:
         *Before reporting:*
         - Confirm the problem is reproducible on [**master**](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/nightly) or [**latest stable**](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/stable) release
         - run `make distclean` when encountering build issues
-        - search [existing issues](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug)
-        - check the [FAQ](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/FAQ)
+        - search [existing issues](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug,bug-crash) (including [closed!](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+label%3Abug%2Cbug-crash))

comment_data.body: Hmm reviewing it again, put here (steps to reproduce) or move to previous section? ("problem" or "before reporting") which might be *a little* better place?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -24,6 +24,7 @@ body:
       label: "Steps to reproduce"
       description: |
         - For build failures: list the exact steps including CMake flags (if any).
+        - If the bug pertains to crashing (or segfault), please include a [stacktrace](https://neovim.io/doc/user/dev_tools.html#dev-tools-backtrace).

comment_data.body:
But I do like the suggestion to add (more) guidance to issue reporters. We should think about how to structure the issue template better to achieve this (including, possibly, with checkboxes).

If anybody has come across good examples we could <del>steal</del> adapt from other projects, please share them (in a dedicated issue or PR)!

comment_data.body: I second @clason's point especially because of the "task list". It doesn't seem easily possible at the moment, until is done: https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/5197
